thread.title: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney to start FA Cup third-round tie against Reading
thread.title_full: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney to start FA Cup third-round tie against Reading

author: David McDonnell
title: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney to start FA Cup third-round tie against Reading
text:
Wayne Rooney is in line to return to United's team in the FA Cup against Reading (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Wayne Rooney will make his return for Manchester United in tomorrow's FA Cup tie against Reading. 
The United skipper has missed his side's last three games with a muscle injury but has returned to training and will start at Old Trafford. 
United's second-choice keeper Sergio Romero will also start, meaning No 1 David de Gea will be afforded a rest for the third round tie. 
Reds boss Jose Mourinho intends to make changes to his side, with United facing Hull in the first leg of their EFL Cup semi-final on Tuesday. Rooney hasn't played since United's win at West Brom on December 18 (Photo: PA) 
"Iâ€™m going to make some changes," said Mourinho. "All of our players are good players and I trust them all. 
"We play against a very good opponent [Reading] but I trust my players. If we are in the right frame of mind we can win." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
